p: The contents of long‐chain n‐alkanes in marine sediments can help to interpret the variations of terrestrial input. They ranged from 38.2 to 84.7 ng/g and showed two periods over time according to STARS analysis (Figure 3a): (1) 1940–2002 was relatively stable with an average of 51.0 ng/g, although STARS detected a small decreasing shift (RSI < 0.1) in 1960; (2) 2002–2011 displayed higher values, with an average of 65.5 ng/g, with one significant increasing shift (RSI: 0.5) in 2002.
